intro: Pyrus sinensis var. ussuriensis, commonly known as the Ussuri pear, is a variant of the Chinese white pear. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 4–8 meters, featuring broad, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. The tree produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, which are followed by pear-shaped fruits that ripen in late summer. The fruit has a sweet, sometimes slightly acidic flavor and is often used in both culinary and medicinal applications. It is native to the regions of eastern Asia, including parts of Russia and China.
